name: Dashboard Reader
author: Felix Krusch

sections.description: Dashboard Reader is more than a plugin; it’s a bridge to a time when the web was a frontier of endless possibilities and discoveries. It’s your tool to reclaim that sense of wonder and efficiency, keeping you informed and inspired as you navigate through your day. Welcome to your modern-day command center for all things web, a nod to the past but fully equipped for the future.
sections.installation:
1. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  2. Go to Dashboard Reader settings under the Settings menu to configure your RSS feeds.
  3. RSS Feeds appear in dashboard. Arrange the widgets as needed.
sections.faq:
Can I display feeds from any site?

Yes, Dashboard Reader can display feeds from any site that offers RSS feeds.

How many feeds can I add?

You can add as many feeds as you like. Yes we use transient caching for better performance reasons, but it’s recommended to keep the number reasonable.

Is it possible to adjust the refresh rate for the feeds?

Yes, you can set a custom refresh interval for the feeds from the Dashboard Reader settings page.

short_description: Displays multiple RSS feeds in the WordPress admin dashboard, each in its own widget.
